articles.title: Austin Weisgrau

Austin Weisgrau

              Austin Weisgrau

            Bio
            I am a software developer for Movement Labs and a data science student at the UCSB Bren School of Environmental Science & Management. I hold a bachelor’s degree in Economics from Reed College, where I studied environmental and natural resource economics with a focus on climate change.
            I believe we need powerful social movements to win transformative environmental legislation. I worked for 4 years as a community organizer building power for economic and environmental justice in the San Francisco Bay Area.
            Once the pandemic hit and much community organizing work transitioned online, I worked with Movement Labs to help send 50 million voter registration and turnout texts in the lead up to the 2020 election. I learned that tech tools can support the frontline organizers who are building people power. Now I build automations & data pipelines for progressive political organizations to help them get more done, work smarter, and make better use of their data.
            
            
            Education
            UCSB Bren School of Environmental Science & Management | Santa Barbara, CA     M.A. Environmental Data Science, Expected June 2022
            Reed College | Portland, OR     B.A. Economics, 2015
            
            
            Experience
            Movement Labs | Tech & Operations Associate | July 2020 - Present
            Jewish Youth for Community Action | Program Coordinator | September 2018 - February 2020
            Service Employees International Union, Local #1021 | Organizer | October 2016 - August 2018
